definitions.definition: a person who is watching an event, especially a sports event

examples.text: The new football stadium will hold 75 000 spectators.
Thousands of spectators lined the route of the royal procession.
He was rendered a virtual spectator for large parts of the game.
Spectators lined the route of the president's walkabout.
I think soccer is the best spectator sport there is.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from French spectateur or Latin spectator, from spectare ‘gaze at, observe’, frequentative of specere ‘to look’.
